actions.in_committee: House Committee on Energy and Commerce
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Health and the Environment.

official_title: To permit the Secretary of Health and Human Services to grant waivers to States to provide coverage under State health care delivery programs to individuals who are otherwise eligible for benefits under title XVIII of the Social Security Act or eligible to enroll under State plans for medical assistance under title XIX of such Act.
short_title: State Health Care Reform Incentive Act of 1992

summary.text: State Health Care Reform Incentive Act of 1992 - Amends titles XVIII (Medicare) and XIX (Medicaid) of the Social Security Act to permit States to seek waivers of program requirements in order to provide health care coverage under certain regular or alternative State programs. Establishes Federal requirements for such State programs. Sets forth payment provisions.

titles.title: State Health Care Reform Incentive Act of 1992

To permit the Secretary of Health and Human Services to grant waivers to States to provide coverage under State health care delivery programs to individuals who are otherwise eligible for benefits under title XVIII of the Social Security Act or eligible to enroll under State plans for medical assistance under title XIX of such Act.
